TopicTitle: How do I get a Minmus equatorial orbit?

Articles.Content:
I don't think I can target the moon and burn at inclination nodes, so I dunno what to do.

 

EDIT:  Nevermind, I can use KER to do it.

Edited January 24, 2017 by SlabGizor117
Burn normal or anti-normal when your orbit takes you across its equator. Use a tool such as KER to tell your exact inclination.

23 minutes ago, Ohm is Futile said:

Burn normal or anti-normal when your orbit takes you across its equator. Use a tool such as KER to tell your exact inclination.

^^

4 answers without mods. Pick the best one for you:

  1. Take a contract for a Minmus equatorial satellite, and complete it. Leave that satellite in place and use it to set the orbits of any other ship.
  2. Plant flags at the poles. Land a rover or hopper near the equator, and drive or hop north or south until you are equidistant from each flag. Then use it to set the orbits of any other ship. I haven't tested this, but you should be able to see the orbit of any "landed" ship. If not, just launch into orbit once you're on the equator.
  3. Same as above, though use an online map to find a surface feature exactly on the equator and land at that surface feature.
  4. Realize that if you can't find a perfect equatorial orbit, maybe it actually doesn't matter.
Edited January 24, 2017 by 5thHorseman
